thread.title: Kenya: Trade Lobbies Face Penalties for Unethical Practices
thread.title_full: Kenya: Trade Lobbies Face Penalties for Unethical Practices

title: Kenya: Trade Lobbies Face Penalties for Unethical Practices
text:
Africa: South Africa Defends Regulated Hunting 
Anti-competitive trade practises include collusive tendering, market divisions, price fixing and the application of different conditions to equivalent transactions. 
Others are practices that prevent competition and the use of intellectual property rights in a manner that goes beyond limits of of legal protection. 
"The SCP is motivated by the realisation that notwithstanding the coming into force of the Act, trade associations continue to have rules, practices and procedures which are likely to contravene the Act," Kariuki said. 
CAK is targeting lobbies in the financial services and agricultural sectors. The two sectors have majority of the active associations and control the largest share of the national wealth as measured by gross domestic product. Kenya
